name: Creating Security Lists
description: Walkthrough on creating a Security List.

steps.message: A security list is a virtual firewall rules for your VCN (outside of the instance firewall rules). Helps to specify which traffic is allowed in and out of your VCNs. </br></br>VCNs are created with one default security lists, and more can be created to manage different security list for each subnet. </br> In this tutorial we will show you how to create a Security List.

Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Networking" and click "Virtual Cloud Networks".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcnmenu.png}}
Choose the VCN you wish to add security list to. Under Resources, Click Security Lists, then Create Security List. </br> {{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcnseclist.png}}

Choose the compartment for the Security List and Apply a name. Here allows you to add all the Ingress and Egress rules for the security list.
Tip: Ingress rules are traffic incoming to your Oracle VCN, and Egress rules are managing traffic outgoing your VCNs.
For more information on Ingress vs Egress and Stateless vs Stateful go to here.
Create the Security List. Now, when you create a subnet you can choose the custom Security Lists in the drop down menu instead of the default.

To add security rules to the new security list click on the name. You can choose whether to add Ingress or Egress rules. Lets allow HTTP traffic into our VCN.
Tip: Ingress rules are security rules that check inbound traffic to your VCN.
Egress rules check any outbound traffic from your VCN.

We'll add an Ingress rule to allow port 80 from any source IP. Click on Add Ingress rule. </br> Source Type choose CIDR. Source CIDR: 0.0.0.0/0. IP Protocol: TCP. Source Port Range: ALL. Destination Port Range: 80. </br> {{img-url:/images/tutorials/vcningress.png}}
Now we set up security list properly! Add your proper Ingress and Egress rules for your VCN.
